title: Road safety and its modification

author: Ljubo Zajc, Ministry of Transport of the Republic of Slovenija, Government of the Republic of Slovenia

segmentation: Good afternoon dear ladies and gentlemen in in next few minutes I would like to present you some information about the road safety in the Slovenia.
Some information from our past and I would like to present you in a few sentence how we see our future in Slovenia in this area.
Key for the 1st.
I would like to show you this picture over the last 12 years.
Great advances have been made in Slovenian Rd safety area between 1994 where we see that we had 505 Rd users died on Slovenian roads and 2003 when 242 died.
It's in this time we succeed in more than halving the number of deaths.
What are the key reasons for this?
The Traffic Safety success between 1994 and 2003 was based on the fact that in this.

Alongside the construction of new motorways and modernization of the vehicles on the road, but were chiefly lower cost, Traffic Safety measures were implemented and in terms of benefits, they brought a great reduction in the number of deaths.
These measures were also the measures of fear of new types of punishment.
Like penalty points, system is and the higher penalties in the Road Safety Act of 1998.

These measures of fear were combined by the preventive and by preventive measures and by the measures in the field of police supervision, the frequency of which in certain areas like spinning seat belt using and alcohol, was more than doubled.
As you can see in this slide, Slovenian goal is to prevent the number of casualties from exceeding 100.
24 by the end of 2008 this mean that we would like to have the number of our debts in next.
40 three years.
But you can also see from the upper line that in the past four years we falling short of achieving this goal.
With two 193 deaths on the roads.
Has found himself Slovenia has found himself in the company of Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia and Poland is one of the least safe European countries.
Why has there been no progress in the last four years?
In my personal opinion, the key reasons for our own success include the facts death.
The low-cost and highly profitable Traffic Safety measures have more or less been used up.
Secondly, the intensity of police supervision has been reduced.
In comparison, between 2003 and 2006, a drop indicates a drop off as much as 250,000 in the number of detected traffic offenses.
And death that he'll be no new initiatives in the form of a new national program of Rd Safety and the Joint Program in 2007 have not yield the anticipated results.
Road deaths in you have fallen by more than 70% since 2001, but they are still there still too high.
The temporary data for 2007 shows that 16 EU countries did not manage to reduce the number of deaths.
On the contrary, the debt tool has only increased beside Slovenia here also Scandinavian countries like Denmark, Finland and Sweden, which traditionally have the lowest level of that talk.
The new National Rd safety.
Sleeping in a Rd safety program is based on Vision 0.
The national program stressed the power and sense of greater awareness about Rd safety.
A major future of the national program is the commitment to clear and responsible action as required by the rules and ensuring the much greater involvement of all levels of authority.
National, Regional, Local and cooperation of the civil society.
This thinking signifies a shift in the culture and division of responsibility for General Rd safety, be it among the creators or among the participants in Rd traffic.
The Slovenian government adopted the Road Safety Action Plan for 2008 in 2009, which represented the implementation part of our National Rd Safety plan.
This action plan contains the different key.
It measures.

In the last 40 years, the authority competent for Rd safety in the Republic of Slovenia was the Ministry of Interior, which was entrusted with the tasks of developing, managing, coordinating and supervising strategic process relating to Rd safety.
The reason for this can be attributed to the historical and organizational development of off road safety in Slovenia.
With the transfer of the above state, stated competence is from the Ministry of Interior to the Ministry of Transport.
In February 2006, historical step was made in the Development Rd safety.
We got the new Road Safety Council which is made up of highly respected national professors, professionals and researchers.
It works like advisory body of the transport minister.
And we also established the Intergovernmental Group, which has monitor, assess, coordinate and control the implementation of the Strategic Rd safety process in the country.
In the regions of Polska and Padrera this is the eastern part of Slovenia.
We established temporary ad hoc regional Rd safety group.
The reason for the establishing the groups were the lowest level of Rd safety and failure to achieve national goals.
Now a few words about them operate our opportunities.
For improving growth safety in this respect, Vision Zero requires a change in the thinking and approach of the system designers.
The implementers Android users.
Vision Zero transfers some of the responsibility for creating a safe system to each and every Co creator and user of the roads, and as such is becoming standard.
Key player, human and political concern for greater Rd safety throughout the.
Slovenia.
Here I can also mention that we will we will try to increase preventive activities coupled with increase of police control.
Then we know that we have to introduce in modeling information surveillance technologies.
And.
We would like modernizing Rd safety legislation.
At the end of the April we will get we will get.
Some changes.
Off nowadays Safety Act but.
We started work of modernizing of our Rd safety legislation and we intent.
To divide it existed Rd Safety Act in four different in four different particular act.
The first act will cover the whole area, the whole area of wiggles, the 2nd about Rd, infrastructures the third drivers and the 4th Act with will cover the traffic rules, fans and police warrants.
And.
Let me finish where I started.
I mentioned that Slovenia reached a great success by the howling.
The number of deaths between 1998 and 2003, and we believe that we can achieve.
New road safety success in a different and new way which will imbue us with new enthusiasm, new wheels and new expectations.
Thank you.
Interesting presentation.
I was impressed that Vision Zero found.
Spy price so.
So then yeah and then.
You are approaching Rd safety, so you shouldn't.
So in the basic way of changing the way of thinking of all peoples who are responsible for Rd safety.
So questions or comments.
OK before before somebody find the question I. I would like to ask.
Audi coincidence of your leadership of police between 89 and 2006 and the success of the heart finger of the number of fatalities because it's a clear coincidence.
So you mention in the very beginning that you introduce very, very strict enforcement measures.
You introduce penalty points system so.
It's the idea to continue in this strong competition enforcement.
I'm making this question are intentionally cause in our country in the Czech Republic we introduce the penalty points system since 1st of July 2006.
So in the first months it was a great success, but then our citizens recognized that police disappeared from the road.
So it's I have to say that.
Why disaster in result of this penalty point system?
So my question is if you are going to to increase the person involvement into our system?
Thank you, I started to work like a traffic policeman.
More than 20 years ago and in 1998 I started to lead the traffic police force in Slovenia and at that time like I mentioned before, we meet one of the worst Rd safety situation in our country.
505 people died at that time on the Slovenian Road and at that time decided that we have to do something very quick and.
More or less.
Efficient.
We started to.
Study a different police strategies or over the world and the normally.
After this study we decided decided that we will take very pragmatic approach.
We decided that we will do something in the area of speeding, drink driving and the using of safety belts.
And in first year we decided that we will double the police fines.
This practical fancies and what was happened in the first year.
The number of deaths decreasing for 104 people.
This mean around 1/4 of all deaths on the Slovenian roads.
And normally we continue with this type of work, not only on the basis of fear and punishment.
We try to do also something.
Together with the preventive measures and.
We did this till 2010 2003.
My personal opinion is that in this last in this 10 years we used all.
R. Cost effective little cost effective measures and now we are in the phase that we need measures.
Which they are need more money and more professional and other other knowledge.
On this, on this basis we also do did a new National Rd safety program 2007 till 2011.
And we established this group who coordinates all all national activities on this in this plan, and one of the key role key player in this group is also traffic police.
What we would like we would like to.
Modernizr we would like to see that the Slovenian traffic police will modernize itself in next few years.
We would like to get the when we talk about the speeding.
We would like to get in this year.
We would like to get experiment about section control when we talk about the speeding and we would like to get this section control in Slovenian motorways in next 4 years.
This is 1 police measure and discounting.
The third was that we would like to have.
The more police presence on the Slovenian Rd, not more, not more fines, but more policemen and.
One of the motor of the swimming and traffic police.
Is that the quality of their work?
Is the 1st and the quantity is on the 2nd on the second level?
This is my answer on your question.
Thank you for this expression.
So I'm, uh, repeating my question to the audience.
Are there any other questions?
You are a yes.
What role has public education campaign?
Induction.
And have you been?
Allergies to compensate?
Yes, thank you.

When we transfer the coordination task from the Ministry of Interior to the Ministry of Transport, one of the consequences of this transferring was also increasing, increasing the money which we spent in last two years for public education.
Just for instance, in 2006, at 2006 years we spent around 200.
Save up.
270,000 euros for public education and this year we will spend around 1,000,000 and we expect that this this will these numbers will increase in next few years.
We also prepare and you knew preventive campaigns this year.
And we will try to modernizing it.
And the second question was.
In future.
Yeah.
Yeah.
We know that we we cannot do the same job with the traffic police like we did it before becausw.
Nowadays we met less and less traffic policemen on the roads and we know that we have to modernize the police force and modernize on the way that we will make more automatic control when we.
When we talk about the speeding driving through the red light and the other traffic offenses, my personal opinion that this is 1.
This will be one of the main main direction too.
To developing this working area.
I hope so.
So thank you very much for your presentation for the additional explanation, and I love you.
Good success.
